titleStmt.title: Building the ELTeC: creating marked up texts

div.head: Objectives and prerequisites
div.p:
In this one day workshop you'll learn:
what TEI XML markup is and why we use it for the ELTeC
how ELTeC texts should be marked up, at levels 0 and 1
some practical ways of creating ELTeC texts starting from other formats, in particular :
plain text output by an OCR system
digital documents created with Word or Open Office
ePub or HTML documents found on the internet
You should have some previous experience of working with digital documents for example, creating web pages, or editing documents with Word.
Almost all the work will be done using oXygen XML Editor. If you don't already have it installed, we recommend you to download an evaluation copy of this software before the workshop!

list.item: Practical session 1: what is oXygen? What can we do with it? (45 mins)
What is the TEI and why are we using it? (30 mins)
Practical session 2: creating a level 0 text from OCR output (60 mins)
Understanding ELTeC: explaining level 0 and level 1 schemas (30 mins)
Practical session 3: converting from Word (45 mins)
Understanding and creating the ELTeC header (30 mins)
Practical session 4: working on your own document (60 mins)
Converting from ePub and HTML : some examples (30 mins)
